Do you require urgent protection?

The hearing of an application for a protection order will not be held immediately. It may be a few weeks until your court date.

{{RespondentName true}} has the right to get a copy of the application so that {{respondentThey}} {{respondentTheyKnow}} what has been said and can respond in court. Police will serve the respondent with a copy of the application.

You can ask the clerk of the court to arrange an earlier court date (before {{respondentName}} has been served) so the magistrate can consider whether to make a temporary protection order.

You will still need to go to court later. {{RespondentName}} will be given a copy of your application which includes a notice to appear in court at the same time. A temporary protection order will cover {{aggrievedYou}} until then.

  1. Has {{respondentName}} committed domestic and/or family violence recently?
  2. Are you concerned {{aggrievedYou}} will be harmed again before {{aggrievedYour}} court date? It could be a few weeks before the court will hear your application.
  3. Do you think {{respondentName}} will harm {{aggrievedYou}} once {{respondentTheyReceive}} a copy of this application?

  4. Is there another reason why urgent protection is required?

    It is your choice to apply for a temporary protection order. However, you must have clear reasons for the magistrate to grant this without giving {{respondentName}} a chance to have {{respondentTheir}} say.

  5. Do you want to apply for a temporary protection order?
